conbody.p: The Git integration supported in is based on EGit. For detailed instruction, you can refer to the Eclipse Foundation document on EGit/User Guide. A typical workflow of Git integration with is depicted in the following diagram:

With Git integration, you can use Git commands directly from . allows you to create and manage branches, view commit changes, pull request to sync the changes between the remote server and your local repository, and so on.

The integration also allows you to optimize your software testing life cycle without leaving . You can keep track of different versions of your project, while also maintaining a backup version of the source code. Your team collaboration is better: your team can work in parallel on their own branches, then share, test, and merge the changes upon completion.
You can integrate with Git and its cloud-hosted services, including:
If you are using , see: Git integration in Katalon Studio.
If you are using , see: Git integration in Katalon Studio - Platform Edition.
